column4: Ok I am pissed off, could someone help me get pidgin to work again?
give us a specific problem to solve and we'll gladly help you
for an AIM account or another account?
or did it just start disconnecting
try deleting ~/.purple and restarting pidgin and setting up your accounts again
~/.purple is the path you want to delete
nobody said it was.  ~/.purple is the path you want to delete
googling "ubuntu recover grub" yields tons of results and howtos for getting grub nworking again
mkfs is the command used to make a filesystem on a partition
gparted is a pretty straightforward gui app.  Do you have a specific question abou tit?
